jaaJSU.{global}.name: jaaJSU.{global}
jaaJSU.{global}.description: Namespaces container (module) which registers namespaces into the global (typically `window`).

$array.{namespace}.description: This NAMESPACE provides features for Arrays.

$async.{namespace}.description: This NAMESPACE provides features for async (mainly Promise) functions.

$dom.component [cordova].name: $dom.component [cordova]
$dom.component [cordova].description: This 'functional class' is syntax sugar around [`DocumentFragment`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentFragment) for creating DOM components and their adding to live DOM in performance friendly way.

params.name: el_name
params.description:
- Name of element (for example `LI`, `P`, `A`, ...).
 - This is parent element of component.

params.name: attrs
params.description:
- The second argument for [`$dom.assign`](./$dom.{namespace}.html#methods_assign)
 - There is one change. It is supported using `onupdate` key ... see [`add`](#methods_add)
     - `onupdate` is array `[ object, function]`, the function is called during creating element and evry `update`calls
     - It returns additional `attrs`, for example this `attrs`: `{ className: "class", onupdate: [ { a }, _=>({ textContent: a }) ] }` => final `attrs= { className: "class", textContent: "A" }` (if `a="A"`)
     - it use similar algorithm like [`$dom.assign`](./$dom.{namespace}.html#methods_assign) (**no deep copy!!!**)

props.name: mapUpdate
props.description:
- `[params.mapUpdate=undefined]`
 - This function (if defined) remap `update(DATA)` to varibales used in keys `attrs.onupdate` ... see [`add`](#methods_add)

return.description:
- 'functional class instance': object `{ add, component, mount, update, share }`
 - `share` is Object for transfering methods somewhere else (like for using in another component, see [`component`](#methods_component))
     - `share= { mount, update, destroy, isStatic }`

$dom.component.name: $dom.component
$dom.component.description: This 'functional class' is syntax sugar around [`DocumentFragment`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentFragment) for creating DOM components and their adding to live DOM in performance friendly way.

params.name: el_name
params.description:
- Name of element (for example `LI`, `P`, `A`, ...).
 - This is parent element of component.

params.name: attrs
params.description:
- The second argument for [`$dom.assign`](./$dom.{namespace}.html#methods_assign)
 - There is one change. It is supported using `onupdate` key ... see [`add`](#methods_add)
     - `onupdate` is array `[ object, function]`, the function is called during creating element and evry `update`calls
     - It returns additional `attrs`, for example this `attrs`: `{ className: "class", onupdate: [ { a }, _=>({ textContent: a }) ] }` => final `attrs= { className: "class", textContent: "A" }` (if `a="A"`)
     - it use similar algorithm like [`$dom.assign`](./$dom.{namespace}.html#methods_assign) (**no deep copy!!!**)

props.name: mapUpdate
props.description:
- `[params.mapUpdate=undefined]`
 - This function (if defined) remap `update(DATA)` to varibales used in keys `attrs.onupdate` ... see [`add`](#methods_add)

return.description:
- 'functional class instance': object `{ add, component, mount, update, share }`
 - `share` is Object for transfering methods somewhere else (like for using in another component, see [`component`](#methods_component))
     - `share= { mount, update, destroy, isStatic }`

classitems.description:
Function which calculate final index for cylce looping
Means from current index `i` get `s`th value in array which length is `l`
classitems.name: arrayIndex

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught Array `iterable`.
classitems.name: each

params.name: i_function
params.description:
* This procedure is called for each element in `iterable` Array.
 * `i_function(value,index)`
     * `value` Mixed: Nth value for `key` in `iterable`.
     * `index` Number: Idicies 0...`Object.keys(iterable).length`.
     * `last` Boolean: Is setted True, if it is the last element in array.

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught Array `iterable` like [each](#methods_each), but use `for(...;(item= iterable[i]);i++)...`.
classitems.name: eachDynamic

params.name: i_function
params.description:
* This procedure is called for each element in `iterable` Array.
 * `i_function(value,index)`
     * `value` Mixed: Nth value for `key` in `iterable`.
     * `index` Number: Idicies 0...`Object.keys(iterable).length`.
     * `last` Boolean: Is setted True, if it is the last element in array.

classitems.description: Function returns last element in array without editing the original.
classitems.name: getLast

classitems.description: Function returns methods for splitting array by condition.
classitems.name: partition

return.description:
* `{headd, tail, onIndex, byCondition}`
     * `head: function()`: returns two items Array [x, ...xs] (first element and rest array)
     * `tail: function()`: returns two items Array [...xs, x] (rest array and last element)
     * `onIndex: function(index)`: returns two items Array [arr1, arr2] (splite original `arr` into two arrays on given index `index`)
     * `byCondition: function(fn)`: returns two items Array [arr1, arr2] (splite original `arr` into two arrays based on function `fn`)
         * `fn(curr, i)`
             * `curr` Mixed: Current element in array `arr`
             * `i` Number: Current index in array `arr`
             * **Returns** Boolean: 0/1 (True/false) if add to arr1/arr2

classitems.description: Function returns new array without any `item`
classitems.name: removeItem

params.name: item
params.description:
* Item for searching in `arr`
 * Make sence, if it is possible to compare with `===` operation

classitems.description: Function returns random number for Array.sort function
classitems.name: sortRandom

classitems.description:
Procedure for iterating thorught **Promise** function array `funcs`.

**Deprecated:** Use [iterate_](#methods_iterate_), [sequention_](#methods_sequention_), [each_](#methods_each_)
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: funcs
params.description: * Array of Promises for iterating (the next always waiting fro previous Promise).

return.description:
* `then`
     * `<= prev` **\<Mixed\>**: result of prev function in `funcs`
 * `catch` 
     * `<= err` **\<Error\>**: Error in `funcs[nth]`

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating thorught **Promise** function array `funcs`.
classitems.name: iterate_

params.name: iterablePromises
params.description: * Array of Promises for iterating (the next always waiting fro previous Promise).

return.description:
* `then`
     * `<= prev` **\<Mixed\>**: result of prev function in `iterablePromises`
 * `catch` 
     * `<= err` **\<Error\>**: Error in `iterablePromises[nth]`

classitems.description:
Like `iterate_`, but also allows iterate throught non-promise functions

**Beta:**  Use [iterate_](#methods_iterate_), [sequention_](#methods_sequention_), [each_](#methods_each_)
classitems.name: iterateMixed_

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught **Promise** functions (wait pattern).
classitems.name: sequention_

params.name: functions
params.description: * Promises for iterating (the next always waiting fro previous Promise).

return.description:
* `then`
     * `<= prev` **\<Mixed\>**: result of prev function in `functions`
 * `catch` 
     * `<= err` **\<Error\>**: Error in `functions[nth]`

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught **Promise** functions (race pattern).
classitems.name: each_

return.description:
* `then`
     * `<= prev` **\<Mixed\>**: result of prev function in `functions`
 * `catch`
     * `<= err` **\<Error\>**: Error in `functions[nth]`

classitems.description: Calls `.then` when the DOM is ready
classitems.name: ready_

classitems.description: Calls `.then` when the DOM element is available/reday (uses `requestAnimationFrame`)
classitems.name: elementReady_

params.name: el_selector
params.description:
* `el_selector.*`
     * Key is name of "selection" function ('querySelector, ..., getElementsByClassname, ...)
     * Value is argument for selection function
 * example: `{getElementsByClassname: "class_name"}`

return.description:
* `.then`
     * Calls when `el` (see next line) ready
     * `<= el` **\<Node\>**: is DOM element based on `parent` and `el_selector` (`el= parent[el_selector[Object.keys(el_selector)[0]]](el_selector[el_selector[Object.keys(el_selector)[0]]])`)

classitems.description: Procedure remove children of given element `container`.

classitems.description: Procedure places `new_element` after `reference` elements

classitems.description: Remove elements in given {NodeList} or {HTMLCollection}
classitems.name: removeElements

classitems.description: Procedure replaces `el_old` element by new one (`new_el`)

classitems.description: Alias for `element.setAttribute(attribute_name, element.getAttribute(attribute_name) === attribute_a ? attribute_b : attribute_a)`
classitems.name: toggleAttribute

classitems.description: Alias for `element.dataset[data_name]= element.dataset[data_name] === data_a ? data_b : data_a`

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught NodeList `iterable`.
classitems.name: each

params.name: i_function
params.description:
* This procedure is called for each element in `iterable` Array.
 * `i_function(value,index)`
     * `value` Mixed: Nth value for `key` in `iterable`.
     * `index` Number: Idicies 0...`Object.keys(iterable).length`.
     * `last` Boolean: Is setted True, if it is the last element in array.

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught NodeList `iterable` like [each](#methods_each), but use `for(...;(item= iterable[i]);i++)...`.
classitems.name: eachDynamic

params.name: i_function
params.description:
* This procedure is called for each element in `iterable` Array.
 * `i_function(value,index)`
     * `value` Mixed: Nth value for `key` in `iterable`.
     * `index` Number: Idicies 0...`Object.keys(iterable).length`.
     * `last` Boolean: Is setted True, if it is the last element in array.

classitems.description: Functional-like alternative for `for(...){functions[nth](..input);}`.
classitems.name: each

return.description:
* For given `...input` calls all functions in `...functions` (use `...input` as arguments for these functions)
 * `<= ...input` **\<Mixed\>**: arguments for `...functions`

classitems.description: Converts `...input`s to new Array based on `...functions`
classitems.name: map

params.name: functions
params.description:
* `...functions[nth](..input){...return __OUTPUT__;}`
 * `__OUTPUT__` element of final array
 * List of functions.

example:
console.log($function.map(
         a=>a+1,
         a=>a-1,
         a=>a+2,
         a=>a-2
     )(5));//= [6, 4, 7, 3]

classitems.description: Procedure for creating functional flow (sequention *function1->function2->...*). Particually similar to [each](#methods_each). But, as arguments for current function is used output frome previous function.
classitems.name: sequention

params.name: functions
params.description:
* List of functions.
 * `...functions[nth](__INPUT__){... return __OUTPUT__;}`
 * `__INPUT__` is `...input` (for first function) or `...__OUTPUT__`
 * `__OUTPUT__` must be **\<Array\>**! `...__OUTPUT__` is used as argument for next function in `...functions`.

return.description:
* For given `...input` calls all functions in `...functions` (use `...input` as arguments for first function)
 * `<= ...input` **\<Mixed\>**: arguments for first function

example:
console.log($function.sequention(
         a=>[a+1, a-1],
         (a,b)=>[b-1, a+1]
     )(5));//= [3, 7]

     console.log($function.sequention(
         a=>[a+1],
         a=>[a+2]
     )(5));//= [8]

    console.log($function.sequention(
         a=>a+1, //wrong non-array return
         a=>a+2  //wrong non-array return
     )(5));//...:4 Uncaught TypeError: (var)[Symbol.iterator] is not a function(â€¦)

classitems.description: Optimized iterator for heavy functions in `functions`. Uses [$optimizier.timeoutAnimationFrame](./$optimizier.{namespace}.html#methods_timeoutAnimationFrame)
classitems.name: schedule

classitems.description: Shorthand for `const mixed= ...; if(mixed) fun(mixed);`
classitems.name: conditionalCall

classitems.description: Function for iterating throught Object `iterable`.
classitems.name: each

params.name: i_function
params.description:
* This procedure is called for each element in `iterable` Object.
 * `i_function(value,key,index)`
     * `value` Mixed: Nth value for `key` in `iterable`.
     * `key` String: Nth key.
     * `index` Number: Idicies 0...`Object.keys(iterable).length`.

classitems.description: Procedure for iterating throught Object `iterable` like [each](#methods_each), but use `for(... in ...)...if(Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty...`.
classitems.name: eachDynamic

params.name: i_function
params.description:
* This procedure is called for each element in `iterable` Object.
 * `i_function(value,key,index)`
     * `value` Mixed: Nth value for `key` in `iterable`.
     * `key` String: Nth key.
     * `iterable` Object: Link to original `iterable`.

classitems.description: Function for converting Array `arr` to Object. Uses `fun` for converting.
classitems.name: fromArray

params.name: fun
params.description:
* **Optional** [`fun= (acc, curr, i)=> acc[""+i]= curr`].
 * Function for converting. In fact, it is wrapper around `Array.reduce`.
 * `fun(acc,curr,i)`
     * `acc` Object: Reference link to output Object.
     * `curr` Mixed: Nth elemnt in Array `arr`.
     * `i` Number: Nth index of `arr`.

classitems.description: Wrapper around `Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty`. It is more trustable, because you can sets `var obj= { hasOwnProperty: "gotcha" }`
classitems.name: hasProp

classitems.description: Function for creating non-rewritable object
classitems.name: immutable_keys

return.description:
* getter `Proxy.key_name` Mixed: returns key_name if defined
 * getter `Proxy.set(key_name, value)` Function:
     * define `key_name` in object if isn't already defined (**returns True**, else **False**).
 * getter `Proxy.keys` Number: Wrapper around `Object.keys(*)`

classitems.description: Wrapper around `object[key]`, usefull for binding.
classitems.name: pluck

classitems.description: Prevent multiple calling (typically for "onresize" events) - use google for more detail
classitems.name: debounce

params.name: wait
params.description: * How much wait for next calling

params.name: immediate
params.description: * First time wait since `wait` (**false**), or call immediate and after wait (**true**) - infact switch *debounce/trottle*

example:
graphically (wait= 4symbols)
    I call (| symbol) fun:    .|||.|.|||..
                 debounce:    .....|....|.
                  trottle:    .|.....|....

classitems.description: Very similar to [debounce](#methods_debounce), but uses `requestAnimationFrame`
classitems.name: trottle

params.name: cycles_leap
params.description: * similar to `wait` - how many times calls `requestAnimationFrame`

classitems.description: Calls `.then` when `fn` returns **true**
classitems.name: poll_
example: poll_(()=>document.readyState!=='loading').then(console.log).catch(console.error);

classitems.description: Prevent multiple calling of `fn`
classitems.name: once

params.name: fn
params.description: * Function which must be called only onetime

classitems.description: Combination of `setTimeout`->`requestAnimationFrame`
classitems.name: timeoutAnimationFrame

params.name: f
params.description: * Function to call later (`delay`+next animation frame)

classitems.description: Clear spaces (`\s+`) in `str`
classitems.name: clearSpaces

classitems.description: Wrapper around `*.substring(*,*)`
classitems.name: getSubstring
letterInc

return.description: * New string with "highter" letter on position `pos`

example:
console.log($string.letterInc("125"));//="126"
    console.log($string.letterInc("125a"));//="125b"
    console.log($string.letterInc("HH"));//="HI"
    console.log($string.letterInc("Hg", 2, 1));//="Hi"

classitems.description: Clear tags from `str`
classitems.name: clearHTML
containsRepeatingChars
example:
console.log($string.containsRepeatingChars("AAbcd"));//=false
    console.log($string.containsRepeatingChars("AAAbcd"));//=true
    console.log($string.containsRepeatingChars("AAAbcd", 3));//=false

classitems.name: containsSequential
example:
console.log($string.containsSequential("ABccc"));//=false
    console.log($string.containsSequential("ABCdd"));//=true
    console.log($string.containsSequential("ABCdd", 3));//=false

classitems.description: Wrapper around `*.trim()`
classitems.name: isFilled

classitems.description: Alternative to ` ```text with ${variable}``` ` (like `sprintf()`)
classitems.name: template

return.description:
* `{execute, partial, isSubstituted}`
     * String **execute** ( [ `params_obj` ={}] )
         * [ `params_obj` ={}] {Object}
             * Keys corresponding to `${0}, ${var}, ...` in `str`
         * **Returns:** String
             * New string with replaced vars
     * String **partial** ( [ `params_obj` ={}] )
         * Replace inside `str`
         * [ `params_obj` ={}] {Object}
             * Keys corresponding to `${0}, ${var}, ...` in `str`
         * **Returns:** String
             * `str` with replaced vars
     * Boolean **isSubstituted** ()
         * **Returns:** Boolean
             * If `str` contains `${0}, ${var}, ...`

example:
const test1= $string.template("${0}, ${1}, ${2}");
    console.log(test1.partial(["A"]));//="A, ${1}, ${2}"
    console.log(test1.execute(["B", "C", "D"]));//="A, C, D"
    console.log(test1.isSubstituted());//=false
    console.log(test1.partial(["_", "B", "C"]));//="A, B, C"
    console.log(test1.isSubstituted());//=true

    const test2= $string.template("${test0}, ${test1}, ${test2}");
    console.log(test2.partial({test0: "A"}));//="A, ${test1}, ${test2}"
    console.log(test2.execute({test0: "B", test1: "C", test2: "D"}));//="A, C, D"
    console.log(test2.isSubstituted());//=false
    console.log(test2.partial({test0: "_", test1: "B", test2: "C"}));//="A, B, C"
    console.log(test2.isSubstituted());//=true

classitems.name: getOrdinalSuffix
example: console.log($time.getOrdinalSuffix(1));//"1st"

classitems.name: getMonthName
example:
console.log($time.getMonthName(5));//"May"
    console.log($time.getMonthName(24, 4));//"Dece"

classitems.description: Function returns timestamp in the form of "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS". Uses [double](#methods_double)
classitems.name: getTimeStamp

classitems.description: Function returns timestamp in the form of "YYYY-MM-DD". Uses [double](#methods_double)
classitems.name: getDateStamp

classitems.description: Function returns timestamp in the form of "HH:MM:SS". Uses [double](#methods_double)
classitems.name: getTimeString

classitems.description: Function returns how much is `time` bigger than `refference_time`. Uses [getTimeStamp](#methods_getTimeStamp), [getDateStamp](#methods_getDateStamp), [getTimeString](#methods_getTimeString)
classitems.name: getDiff

params.name: refference_time
params.description: * Must be convertable into the same format like `time`

classitems.description: Function adds leading zero to the `time`
classitems.name: double

classitems.description: This add element to component
classitems.name: add

params.name: attrs
params.description:
- `null|undefined` is also supported (`null` is probably recommendet for better readability)
 - The second argument for [`$dom.assign`](./$dom.{namespace}.html#methods_assign)

props.name: onupdate
props.description:
- Pattern: `attrs.onupdate= [ Values: Object, Retuns_attrs_keys: Function ]`
 - This register listener/subscriber function (`Retuns_attrs_keys`) for keys (variables) in `Values`
 - Example: `[ {counter}, _=>({ textContent: counter }) ]` registers listerner to `counter`. When the `udate({ ... counter: something, ...})` is called this element changes `textContent`.
 - See [`update`](#methods_update)

params.name: shift
params.description: - Modify nesting behaviur. By default (`shift= 0`), new element is child of previus element. Every `-1` means moving to the upper level against current one - see example.

example:
//#1 const UL= document.getElementById('SOME UL'); const { add }= $dom.component("LI", { className: "list_item" });//
  • ...
    • add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of .list_item", className: "deep1" });//
  • ...
    • add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep1", className: "deep2" });//...
    ...
    ... add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep2", className: "deep3" });//...
    ...
    ... add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep2", className: "deep3 mark" }, -1);//...
    ...
    ...
    ... //next add(*) schoul be child of div.deep3.mark, by -1 it is ch.of div.deep2, by -2 ch.of div.deep1, by -3 ch.of li.list_item because div.deep3.mark is on 3rd level add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep1", className: "deep2 nextone" }, -2);//this is on 2nd level add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep1", className: "deep2 nextone" }, -2);//this is on 0 level add("DIV", null); // just DIV without attributes ...

classitems.description: Method for including another component by usint its `share` key.
classitems.name: component

classitems.description: Add element to live DOM
classitems.name: mount

params.name: element
params.description: - Element where to places this component

params.name: type
params.description:
- Change type of mounting
 - `childLast` places component as last child
 - `childFirst` places component as first child
 - `replaceContent` removes content of `element` and places component as child (uses `$dom.empty`)
 - `replace` replaces `element` by component
 - `before` places component before `element`
 - `after` places component after `element` (uses `$dom.insertAfter`)

classitems.description: Method remove element form live DOM and returns null
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Updates `deep`
classitems.name: recalculateDeep

classitems.description: Returns current `deep` (last element in array)
classitems.name: getParentIndex

classitems.description: Initialize internal storage
classitems.name: initStorage

classitems.description: Method updates all registered varibles by keys `onupdates` and calls follower functions
classitems.name: update

params.name: new_data
params.description:
- When `$dom.component` is initialized, it is possible to register `mapUpdate`
 - **It's because internally, it is used `Object.assign` (no deep copy) to merge new data with older one!!!**

classitems.description: Methods returns if it was `onupdate` used
classitems.name: isStatic

classitems.description: See [add](#methods_add)
classitems.name: add [cordova]

return.description: * First created element (usualy wrapper thanks nesting)

classitems.description:
Procedure for merging object into the element properties.
Very simple example: `$dom.assign(document.body, { className: "test" });` is equivalent to `document.body.className= "test";`.
It is not deep copy in general, but it supports `style`, `style_vars` and `dataset` objects (see below).
classitems.name: assign [cordova]

params.name: object_attributes
params.description:
- Object shall holds **NodeElement** properties like `className`, `textContent`, ... - For `dataset` can be used also `Object` notation: `$dom.assign(document.getElementById("ID"), { dataset: { test: "TEST" } }); //

`. - The same notation can be used for **CSS variables** (the key is called `style_vars`). - **IMPORTANT CHANGE**: Key `style` also supports **text**, so `$dom.assign(el, { style: "color: red;" });` and `$dom.assign(el, { style: { color: "red" } })` is equivalent to `el.setAttribute("style", "color: red;");` - *Speed optimalization*: It is recommended to use `textContent` (instead of `innerText`) and `$dom.add` or `$dom.component` (instead of `innerHTML`).

classitems.description: This add element to component
classitems.name: add

params.name: attrs
params.description:
- `null|undefined` is also supported (`null` is probably recommendet for better readability)
 - The second argument for [`$dom.assign`](./$dom.{namespace}.html#methods_assign)

props.name: onupdate
props.description:
- Pattern: `attrs.onupdate= [ Values: Object, Retuns_attrs_keys: Function ]`
 - This register listener/subscriber function (`Retuns_attrs_keys`) for keys (variables) in `Values`
 - Example: `[ {counter}, _=>({ textContent: counter }) ]` registers listerner to `counter`. When the `udate({ ... counter: something, ...})` is called this element changes `textContent`.
 - See [`update`](#methods_update)

params.name: shift
params.description: - Modify nesting behaviur. By default (`shift= 0`), new element is child of previus element. Every `-1` means moving to the upper level against current one - see example.

example:
//#1 const UL= document.getElementById('SOME UL'); const { add }= $dom.component("LI", { className: "list_item" });//
  • ...
    • add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of .list_item", className: "deep1" });//
  • ...
    • add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep1", className: "deep2" });//...
    ...
    ... add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep2", className: "deep3" });//...
    ...
    ... add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep2", className: "deep3 mark" }, -1);//...
    ...
    ...
    ... //next add(*) schoul be child of div.deep3.mark, by -1 it is ch.of div.deep2, by -2 ch.of div.deep1, by -3 ch.of li.list_item because div.deep3.mark is on 3rd level add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep1", className: "deep2 nextone" }, -2);//this is on 2nd level add("DIV", { textContent: "Child of div.deep1", className: "deep2 nextone" }, -2);//this is on 0 level add("DIV", null); // just DIV without attributes ...

classitems.description: Method for including another component by usint its `share` key.
classitems.name: component

classitems.description: Add element to live DOM
classitems.name: mount

params.name: element
params.description: - Element where to places this component

params.name: type
params.description:
- Change type of mounting
 - `childLast` places component as last child
 - `childFirst` places component as first child
 - `replaceContent` removes content of `element` and places component as child (uses `$dom.empty`)
 - `replace` replaces `element` by component
 - `before` places component before `element`
 - `after` places component after `element` (uses `$dom.insertAfter`)

classitems.description: Method remove element form live DOM and returns null
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Updates `deep`
classitems.name: recalculateDeep

classitems.description: Returns current `deep` (last element in array)
classitems.name: getParentIndex

classitems.description: Initialize internal storage
classitems.name: initStorage

classitems.description: Method updates all registered varibles by keys `onupdates` and calls follower functions
classitems.name: update

params.name: new_data
params.description:
- When `$dom.component` is initialized, it is possible to register `mapUpdate`
 - **It's because internally, it is used `Object.assign` (no deep copy) to merge new data with older one!!!**

classitems.description: Methods returns if it was `onupdate` used
classitems.name: isStatic

classitems.description: Procedure for adding elements into the `parent` (in background use `createDocumentFragment`, `createElement`, `appendChild`)
classitems.name: add

params.name: parent
params.description: * Wrapper (for example `<ul>`) where to cerate children elements (for example `<li>`)

* `[ [ __NAME__, __PARAMS__ ], [ __NAME__, __PARAMS__ ], ..., [ __NAME__, __PARAMS__ ] ]` * Element in array is automatically nested into the previous element. `[["UL",...], ["LI",...], ["SPAN",...]]` creates `
` * `__NAME__` **\**: Name of element (for example `LI`, `P`, `A`, ...) * `__PARAMS__` **\**: Parameters for elements as "innerText", "className", "dataset", ... * see [$dom.assign](#methods_assign) * There is one change with using key "$", which modify elements order and it is not parsed by [$dom.assign](#methods_assign) * `__PARAMS__.$`: Modify nesting behaviur (accepts index of element in `$$$`). `[["UL",...], ["LI",...], ["LI",{$:0,...}]]` creates `
`

return.description: * First created element (usualy wrapper thanks nesting)

classitems.description:
Procedure for merging object into the element properties.
Very simple example: `$dom.assign(document.body, { className: "test" });` is equivalent to `document.body.className= "test";`.
It is not deep copy in general, but it supports `style`, `style_vars` and `dataset` objects (see below).
classitems.name: assign

params.name: object_attributes
params.description:
- Object shall holds **NodeElement** properties like `className`, `textContent`, ... - For `dataset` can be used also `Object` notation: `$dom.assign(document.getElementById("ID"), { dataset: { test: "TEST" } }); //

`. - The same notation can be used for **CSS variables** (the key is called `style_vars`). - **IMPORTANT CHANGE**: Key `style` also supports **text**, so `$dom.assign(el, { style: "color: red;" });` and `$dom.assign(el, { style: { color: "red" } })` is equivalent to `el.setAttribute("style", "color: red;");` - *Speed optimalization*: It is recommended to use `textContent` (instead of `innerText`) and `$dom.add` or `$dom.component` (instead of `innerHTML`).

classitems.description: Redraw element using cheat `*.offsetHeight`
classitems.name: forceRedraw [cordova]

classitems.name: forceRedraw
